messages.message:
Small quality of life improvement: We can now run system test in VS Code/Cursor with debugger support!
Instructions:

1. Open VS Code/Cursor in the `instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests` directory.
2. Run `make build`
3. Run your system test in the run and debug menu. If your test isn't in the list, add it to `.vscode/launch.json` 
By default, the test will run against the aihub-sandbox environment. To run them against a different env, edit the `.vscodeEnv`  file.

Hey Victor, just checking if there is any such trick for running test for Core services.
I am trying to debug `make test` failure in `core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/` and without a debugger setup its getting very annoying :disappointed:
I haven't delved (no pun intended) into the controlplane code before, but there's documentation on go debugging here: https://github.com/golang/vscode-go/wiki/debugging
yeah, was checking that out, I think the complexity is with to get it. work with bazel :thinking_face:
Look into the `substitutePath` attribute in the `launch.json` spec.
